question: We've been on the board for the last twenty minutes. We haven't been able to reach them. There was a transmission ten minutes ago. He identified as "David 14." Then all of a sudden he was cut off.
I don't know.
There's no David 14 on the computer.
You touch me... he dies. If you're not in the air in thirty seconds... he dies. You come back in... he dies. Twenty seconds.
Nineteen. Eighteen.
Seventeen. Sixteen.

We can't wait until tomorrow. If we have to move in and take the island, it's a last resort. It's 8:45. I want permission to try a rescue. Thank you. All right. I know. I'll be OK. I'm not a fool, Plissken.

S.D. Plissken. American Lieutenant. Special Forces Unit, Black Flight. Two Purple Hearts, Leningrad and Siberia. Youngest man to be decorated by the President. You robbed the federal reserve depository. Life sentence, New York Maximum Security Penitentiary. I'm ready to kick your ass out of the world, War Hero.
Hauk. Police Commissioner.
Special Forces Unit. Texas Thunder. We heard of you, too, Plissken.

I have a deal for you. You'll receive full pardon for every criminal act committed in the United States. There was an accident about an hour ago. A small jet went down inside New York City. The President was on board.
That's not funny, Plissken. You go in, find the President and bring him out in 24 hours, and you're a free man.
I'm making you an offer.
Straight just like I said.
No time. Give me an answer.
We're still at war, Plissken. We need him alive.
answer: I don't give a fuck about your war... or your president.

question: Is that your answer?
Think hard.
You flew the Gullfire over Leningrad. You know how to get in quiet. You're all I've got.
answer: I guess I go in one way or the other. Doesn't mean shit to me. Give me the paper.

question: When you come out.
I told you I wasn't a fool, Plissken.
I'll be OK.
I don't like needles.
answer: Twenty-two hours, twenty-nine minutes, fifty-seven seconds...

question: We talked about twenty-four.
answer: In twenty-two hours the Hartford Summit meeting will be over. China and the Soviet Union will go back home. The president was on his way to the summit when his plane went down. He has a briefcase attached to his wrist. The tape recording inside has to reach Hartford in 22 hours.

question: What's on it?
answer: You know anything about nuclear fusion? It's about the survival of the human race, Plissken. Something you don't give a shit about.

question: We'll burn out the charges IF you have the President.
answer: What if I'm a little late?

question: No more Hartford Summit. And no more Snake Plissken.
answer: When I get back I'm going to kill you.

question: You a cop?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: You've got a gun. You got a smoke?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: It's all right if we're quiet. They won't hear us. Hey, this is a real one. You just get in?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Crazies. It's the end of the month. They're out of food.
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Skulls? You kidding? I'm with the Turks now. I just got caught in the street after dark and now I'm stuck here all night.
answer: A plane crashed seven hours ago. Did you see it?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: No.
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: You're a cop.
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Hey, wait a minute. I know who you are. Yeah! But I heard you were dead.
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Wow, Snake Plissken. All right! What you doing in here with a gun, Snake?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Who?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Come on! He really here?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: When you find him, are you gonna take him out?
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Take me out with you, Snake.
speaker1: GIRL IN CHOCK FULL O' NUTS

question: Bad neighborhood, Snake! You don't want to be walking from the Bowery to 42nd street at night! I've been driving a cab here for 30 years and I'm telling you, you don't walk around here at night! Yes, sir! They'll kill you and strip you in ten seconds flat. Usually I'm not down around here myself, but I wanted to catch that show. This stuff is like gold around here, you know. Hey, Snake, when'd you get in? I didn't even know they caught you. Ohhh, Snake Plissken in my cab. Wait'll I tell Eddie! Hey, hang on, Snake. Hey, what were you doing back there, Snake?
Well, why didn't you ask me? Hell, I know everybody in this town. Yes, sir. I've been driving this cab for thirty years, this very same cab.
answer: I'm GONNA ask you. Now where's the President?

question: The Duke's got him! Everyone knows the Duke's got him! You don't have to put a gun to my head. I'll tell you!
The DUKE! The Duke of New York! A-Number-1! The big man, that's who!
answer: I want to meet this Duke.

question: You can't meet the Duke, are you crazy? Nobody wants to meet the Duke! You meet him once and then you're dead! I hate to leave her on the street. Usually I don't leave her alone at all. But you're a special case, Snake. It's OK, Snake. It's a better neighborhood. You can relax.
Boy, they got a great place here. Like a fortress!
Who is it?
Who's me?
What do you want?
answer: Somebody wants to see Brain, it's important --

question: No way, Cabbie --
YOU'RE Plissken?
I'm glad you remember me. Yeah. A man should remember his past. Kansas City, four years ago. You ran out on me. You left me sitting there.
We were buddies, Harold. You, me, and Fresno Bob. You know what they did to Bob? You want to see him sprayed all over that map, baby? Where's the President?!
answer: Swear to god, Snake, I don't know --

question: Don't fuck with me!
answer: Why do you want to know?

question: I want him.
answer: Working for the man now, huh?

question: Then I'll just beat it out of your squeeze --
answer: Mm-hm. Maggie doesn't know EXACTLY where he is and unless you know EXACTLY PRECISELY where he is you'll never find him.

question: ALL RIGHT!!!
Just one thing right now. Don't call me "Harold."
answer: So you work for this Duke, huh?

question: Yeah. Make gas for him. Figure out things for him.
What does he want?
answer: He wants my diagram of the bridge. When he finds out I'm with you he's going to want my life! Shit, Plissken, I knew I shouldn't have listened to you --

question: We've got to get to the President NOW, while he's busy.
answer: Forget it, he's on the other side of town and we got no wheels. The deal is off --

question: Just calm down.
answer: I think they saw us! Turn left, turn left here!

question: I think they saw us! Turn left, turn left here!
I know, I know, the Duke'll take Seventh Avenue, Broadway is five minutes --
Yes!!! Just keep driving!
answer: What's wrong with Broadway? Come on sweetheart . . .

question: Maggie!

He'll be in the third car from the end, by the last campfire. It's all right. He's got to go in the front way. It'll take him five minutes. If you're not back to the car in four minutes you're on your own.
answer: When we get there, Harold, you just keep talking.

question: Hi, guys. Hi . . . how's it going? Cooled off a little, huh?
Duke told us to wait inside. He's on his way here now.
answer: He didn't say nothing to us about it.

question: Well, you can't expect him to tell everybody in the joint, now can you? That's why he's the Duke.
answer: Why don't we wait outside here for him?

question: Why don't we wait inside for him?
What are your specific orders, by the way?
answer: Specific orders, Brain, was for me not to let no one go inside.

question: Are you from the outside?
I can't! Who are you?
answer: Hauk sent me. We've got to move fast.

question: Move fast? You're goddamned right I'll move fast.
They got him. Now watch him.
He had a gun on me, Duke, there was nothing I could do.
Maggie . . .
answer: Who are you? I said who are you?

question: Snake Plissken, Duke. The Man sent him in here. Something's going down . . . we need him.
answer: Snaaaaaake Plissken. I've heard of you. I heard you were dead.

question: We've got to go in now.
You're countermanding my orders, Hauk.
answer: This is my prison, I'll give the orders.

question: I override all that!
I want that diagram, Brain.
answer: Oh. It's at my place, Duke. Duke, that Plissken said something about a time limit.

question: What time limit?
That's a lot of crap. What did I teach you?
answer: You... You are... the Duke of New... New York... You're... A-Number-One.

question: I can't hear you.
answer: YOU ARE... THE DUKE OF NEW YORK... YOU'RE A-NUMBER-ONE!

question: Hello.
Got it from Cabbie.
Traded him.
What are you so nervous about?
answer: I'm here to see the President.

question: Who says?
No he doesn't.
answer: Well... I'll have to tell him you said that.

question: Wait a minute. Why?
answer: He's got something hidden in his clothing. The Duke wants it.

question: What?
You'll tell me.
answer: Cyanide capsules. The Duke don't want a dead president. Gentlemen. Mr. President.

question: Cyanide?
answer: Yeah. He might try to take it tomorrow.

question: Hauk!! Hauk! Plissken's tracer!
answer: Get on the radio! Keep them down! Nobody move!

question: He's approaching the World Trade Center.
answer: I knew that son of a bitch was alive.

question: Goddamned redskins! They're savages, Mr. President! Listen, Snake, I swear to god, I thought you were dead --
answer: Yeah, you and everybody else. That's your car in the lobby? The keys! Quick! Quick! Diagram of the bridge! Hey, hey, hey --

question: I'm the only one who knows how to read that, Snake --
answer: Stay out of my way, Harold.

question: Besides, you can't read and drive at the same time. You need us!
answer: You shouldn't have double-crossed me again, Brain. Come on, let's go --

question: Yeah. Oh, it's all right. I, uh... I want to thank you. Anything you want... you just name it.
answer: Just a moment of your time.

question: Yes?
answer: We did get you out. A lot of people died in the process. I just wondered how you felt about it.
